SummaryQuotes.Quote: "The all-important and crowning blessings of membership in the Church are those blessings which we receive in the temples of God."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"The supreme benefits of membership in the Church can only be realized through the exalting ordinances of the temple."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"I invite the Latter-day Saints to look to the temple of the Lord as the great symbol of your membership."*~ Howard W. Hunter ~
"The way you feel in the temple is a pattern for how you want to feel in your life."*~ Neil L. Anderson ~
"In the temple, all are dressed in spotless white. The symbolic purity of white likewise reminds us that God is to have a pure people."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Preparing children to enter the temple and participate in sacred ordinances is a vital part of the Lord's work of salvation."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"The temple sealing has greater meaning as life unfolds. It will help you draw ever closer together and find greater joy and fulfillment."*~ Richard G. Scott ~
"Every temple is a house of God, filling the same functions and with identical blessings and ordinances."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"Death cannot sever families sealed in the temple. They understand death as a necessary part of God's great plan of happiness."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Another comforting blessing of temple worship is the assurance of protection and peace from the storm that is upon us in our day."*~ Ronald A. Rasband ~
"Our temples are living, working testimonies to our faith in the reality of the resurrection."*~ Dallin H. Oaks ~
"To qualify one's self to go to the temple is a lofty ambition, a worthy achievement. We need to remind ourselves of its eternal purposes"*~ Marvin J. Ashton ~
"To hold a temple recommend is a priceless privilege and a tangible sign of obedience to God and His prophets."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Truly, the Lord desires that His people be a temple-motivated people."*~ Howard W. Hunter ~
"Honors bestowed upon me by men could not approach the inner peace provided by sealings performed in the house of the Lord."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"When you come to the temple you will love your family with a deeper love than you have ever felt before. The temple is about families."*~ Richard H. Winkel ~
"Never allow the goal of the temple to be out of your sight. Walk into His presence in purity and virtue, and receive His blessings"*~ Elaine S. Dalton ~
"You are never lost when you can see the temple. The temple will provide direction for you and your family in a world filled with chaos."*~ Gary E. Stevenson ~
"With increased attendance in the temples of our God, you shall receive increased personal revelation to bless your life..."*~ Ezra Taft Benson ~
"At the temple the dust of distraction seems to settle out, the fog and the haze seem to lift..."*~ Boyd K. Packer ~
"For behold, I have accepted this house, and my name shall be here; and I will manifest myself to my people in mercy in this house."*~ Jesus Christ ~
"As we come unto Christ and journey to higher ground, we will desire to spend more time in His temples..."*~ Joseph B. Wirthlin ~
"Some of the safest places that Heavenly Father has established for the gathering of His people are in the temples of the Lord. "*~ Ronald A. Rasband ~
"I make you a promise that if you will go to the house of the Lord, you will be blessed; life will be better for you."*~ Gordon B. Hinckley ~
"The temple is the house of the Lord. The basis for every temple ordinance and covenant is the Atonement of Jesus Christ."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The temple is a point of intersection between heaven and earth. The temple reminds us of all that is good and beautiful in the world."*~ David A. Bednar ~
"Everything that occurs in the temple is uplifting and ennobling. It speaks of the importance of the family and the eternity of the marriage relationship."*~ Gordon B. Hinckley ~
"I personally regard all of the houses of the Lord as the work of Jehovah, initiated by him, built by him, designed by him, and dedicated to him."*~ Spencer W. Kimball ~
"Let us be a temple-attending and a temple-loving people. Let us hasten to the temple as frequently as time and means and personal circumstances allow."*~ Howard W. Hunter ~
"A temple is literally the house of the Lord, reserved for ordinances of eternal significance."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Temples answer those soul-searching questions of the purpose of life, of why we are here and where we are going."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"The temple is a place of protection and a place of light and truth. It has the power of renewal, of strengthening, of refuge from the storm..."*~ Dieter F. Uchtdorf ~
"[The Temple] is a place where you can take the steps that lead to eternal life and a return home again to our Heavenly Father."*~ Henry B. Eyring ~
"One of the bellwether marks of the growth and vitality of the Church is the construction of temples."*~ Gordon B. Hinckley ~
"Each holy temple stands as a sign of our faith in life after death, and as a sacred step toward eternal glory for us and our families."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The Church is not fully organized, in its proper order, and cannot be, until the Temple is completed."*~ Joseph Smith Jr. ~
"Let this house be built unto my name, that I may reveal mine ordinances therein unto my people."*~ Jesus Christ ~
"Where there are temples, with the spirit of revelation resting upon those who administer therein, there the Lord's people will be found"*~ Bruce R. McConkie ~
"Temples are sacred for the closest communion between the Lord and those receiving the highest and most sacred ordinances of the holy priesthood."*~ Howard W. Hunter ~
"Temple marriage is more than just a place where the ceremony occurs; it is a whole orientation to life and marriage and home."*~ Harold B. Lee ~
"When we dedicate a house to the Lord, what we really do is dedicate ourselves to the Lord's service."*~ Joseph Fielding Smith ~
"I pray with all my soul that all members of the Church and their children ... may realize the great truths presented in the house of the Lord."*~ David O. McKay ~
"Marriage in the temple is one of the most beautiful things in all the world. A couple is led there by love, the most divine attribute of the human soul."*~ David O. McKay ~
"I pray that each of us will honor the Savior and make any necessary changes to see ourselves in His sacred temples."*~ Quentin L. Cook ~
"Every Temple completed ..., lessens the power of Satan on the earth, and increases the power of God and Godlines"*~ George Q. Cannon ~
"Certainly in a day and time like we live in, the importance of every temple built and dedicated to the Lord cannot be overstated."*~ Ronald A. Rasband ~
"I encourage our Saints all over the world, wherever possible, to strive to stand more often in holy places. Our most holy places are our sacred temples."*~ James E. Faust ~
"Come to the temple and place your burdens before the Lord and you'll be filled with a new spirit and confidence in the future."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"Whenever any kind of upheaval occurs in your life, the safest place to be spiritually is living inside your temple covenants!"*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ."*~ Acts 5:42 ~
"And ye are to be taught from on high. Sanctify yourselves and ye shall be endowed with power, that ye may give even as I have spoken."*~ Jesus Christ ~
"And early in the morning [Jesus] came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them."*~ John 8:2 ~
"The temple endowment was given by revelation. Thus, it is best understood by revelation, prayerfully sought with a sincere heart."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Finally it may be said that the temple endowment is not secret. All who meet the requirements for entrance to the temple may enjoy it."*~ John A. Widtsoe ~
"Each holy temple stands as a symbol of our membership in the Church, ... and as a sacred step toward eternal glory for us and our families."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Just as the Salt Lake Temple took 40 years to build, stone by stone, you are building a virtuous life, step by step."*~ Mary N. Cook ~
"If you don't yet love to attend the temple, go more often - not less. Let the Lord, through His Spirit, teach and inspire you there."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"There, in the house of the Lord, you can learn what you need to know to be truly free. ... the chance to be totally unselfish - a rarity in today's world."*~ Robert L. Simpson ~
"Thus Israel gathers for the purpose of building temples in which the ordinances of salvation and exaltation are performed for the living and the dead."*~ Bruce R. McConkie ~
"...establish a house, even a house of prayer, a house of fasting, a house of faith, a house of learning, a house of glory, a house of order, a house of God."*~ D & C 88:119 ~
"I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine eyes and mine heart shall be there perpetually."*~ I Kings 9:3 ~
"I plead with you to seek - prayerfully and consistently - to understand temple covenants and ordinances."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"And I, Nephi, did build a temple; and I did construct it after the manner of the temple of Solomon...and the workmanship thereof was exceedingly fine."*~ 2 Nephi 5:16 ~
"Regular temple attendance is one of the simplest ways you can bless those who are waiting in the spirit world."*~ David B. Haight ~
"As you are true to your covenants made in the temple, you will be strengthened by His power."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"I personally regard all of the houses of the Lord as the work of Jehovah, initiated by him, built by him, designed by him, and dedicated to him."*~ Spencer W. Kimball ~
"Temple. One other word is equal in importance... Home. Put the words holy temple and home together, and you have described the house of the Lord!"*~ Boyd K. Packer ~
"We have thought of thy loving kindness, O God, in the midst of thy temple."*~ Psalms 48:9 ~
"The time will come when there will be temples established over every portion of the land, ... and work for our kindred dead night and day."*~ Lorenzo Snow ~
"I promise that increased time in the temple will bless your life in ways nothing else can."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The feelings of holiness in my home prepared me for feelings of holiness in the temple."*~ James E. Faust ~
"Everything we believe and every promise God has made to His covenant people come together in the temple."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The real blessings of the temple come as we ... feel a spirit of reverence for the temple and a spirit of worship."*~ L. Lionel Kendrick ~
"In every age, the temple has underscored the precious truth that those who make covenants with God and keep them are children of the covenant."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The Temple - the house of the Lord - is a place of security unlike any other."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Our eyes should gaze beyond the baptismal font to the holy temple. The great garner into which the sheaves should be gathered is the holy temple."*~ Neal A. Maxwell ~
"Each person who makes covenants in baptismal fonts and in temples - and keeps them - has increased access to the power of Jesus Christ."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Each of our temples is an expression of our testimony that life beyond the grave is as real and as certain as is our life here on earth."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"The ultimate objective of the gathering of Israel is to bring the blessings of the temple to God's faithful children."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Yea, and my presence shall be there, for I will come into it, and all the pure in heart that shall come into it shall see God."* ~ Jesus Christ ~
"Everything taught in the temple, through instruction and through the Spirit, increases our understanding of Jesus Christ."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"But let us...recite the crowning reason for gathering to Zion or to her stakes. It is to receive the blessings found in the temples of the Lord."*~ Bruce R. McConkie ~
"As we come unto Christ and journey to higher ground, we will desire to spend more time in His temples..."*~ Joseph B. Wirthlin ~
"The temple lies at the center of strengthening our faith and spiritual fortitude because the Savior and His doctrine are the very heart of the temple."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The temple is a place where we can find peace. There we receive a renewed dedication to the gospel and a strengthened resolve to keep the commandments."*~ Thomas S. Monson ~
"When you bring your temple recommend, a contrite heart, and a seeking mind to the Lord's house of learning, He will teach you."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"Understanding the eternal nature of the temple will draw you to your family; understanding the eternal nature of the family will draw you to the temple."*~ Gary E. Stevenson ~
"As we build and maintain these temples, we pray that each of you will build and maintain yourself so you can be worthy to enter the holy temple."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"All of the ordinances that take place in the house of the Lord are expressions of our belief in the immortality of the human soul."*~ Gordon B. Hinckley ~
"When you come to the temple you will love your family with a deeper love than you have ever felt before. The temple is about families."*~ Richard H. Winkel ~
"But the Lord is in his holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before him."*~ Habakkuk 2:20 ~
"With the dedication of each new temple, additional godly power comes into the world to strengthen us and counteracts the intensifying efforts of the adversary."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The temple is ... the most sacred and holy place on earth and should be treated with the greatest degree of reverence and respect."*~ L. Lionel Kendrick ~
"More regular time in the temple will allow the Lord to teach you how to draw upon His priesthood power with which you have been endowed in His temple."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"We must build more temples, and we must build them more quickly. This is the season to build temples. They are needed, and we have the means to do so."*~ Gordon B. Hinckley ~
"During times of our distress when temples are closed, you can still draw upon the power of your temple covenants and endowment as you honor your covenants."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"To accomplish this work there will have to be not only one temple but thousands of them..."*~ Brigham Young ~
"Building and maintaining temples may not change your life, but spending your time in the temple surely will."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
"The peace of the temple is a soothing balm to the wounded soul. ... The temple projects our brief moment in mortality onto the wide screen of eternity."*~ Neil L. Anderson ~

"The crowning jewel of the Restoration is the holy temple. Its sacred ordinances and covenants are pivotal to preparing a people who are ready to welcome the Savior at His Second Coming."*~ Russell M. Nelson ~
